channel.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
channel.description:
Well, (Gosh, I start out just about every damn topic with that word) I've recently created a new 2D game engine, and before I release it, I need to create some demos showing its capability. I'm having some trouble coming up with a cool idea that isn't too big but still very detailed. Therefore, I need your guy's help.
[b]What I'm Looking For:[/b] -A shooter or action game -Platform, isometric, or any other style (preferably platform since that's just a tad harder to do) -Something that would have a lot of animated sprites
[b]What I'm Not Looking For:[/b] -An RPG (These are boring and don't have any physics what-so-ever) -Something with particles -Anything related to RuneScape...
Go.
~Lin

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Alright well, thanks for your ideas, but I decided on a game. Basically you have ships that you can customize, and race & destroy other ships in single or online play. To make things feel more accomplishing, it’s mixed in with an RPG where you get experience, points, and stats, along with money to buy things for your ship, which can include cannons, guns, etc…

Read full topic

I’m still in for music development if you’d ever reach that stage…

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Lin:

Actually, the only reason I said that was because they seem to have the most physics involved. Then again, it depends on the game (Like in Zelda LTTP, the physics in that game would most likely be harder). Just out of curiosity, how did you do the floors you step on? I’m most certain you didn’t make each one an object, but one big image and just made everything that wasn’t white a mask.

Collision on black pixels, other colours mean certain objects/spawn/etc. Any colour other than #000000, #FF0000, #00FF00, #0000FF can be used for map.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Physics being any sort of movement of any object. For example, dashing in link to the past and having it so you move diagonally against diagonal walls and slam/move back on straight ones.

Read full topic

Of course, that depends on your definition of physics.

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:14, topic:359619”][quote author=Budda link=topic=456060.msg3339225#msg3339225 date=1284218091]

-Platform, isometric, or any other style (preferably platform since that’s just a tad harder to do)

protip: platformers are east as fuck.

Having never made one before, I made this in a few hours:
http://www.livestream.com/budda/video?clipId=pla_9bdacd7f-5178-4cb5-9c18-f717becac304&utm_source=lslibrary&utm_medium=ui-thumb
[/quote]Actually, the only reason I said that was because they seem to have the most physics involved. Then again, it depends on the game (Like in Zelda LTTP, the physics in that game would most likely be harder). Just out of curiosity, how did you do the floors you step on? I’m most certain you didn’t make each one an object, but one big image and just made everything that wasn’t white a mask.

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=456060.msg3339335#msg3339335 date=1284224119]
Sorry, It was late when I posted my recent posts.

Make something like, old Nintendo games

So Samus, Megaman, ect.
[/quote]I was gonna, and actually started both, but once I got to using the spritesets and assembling actual sprites, I got bored out of my mind and quit.

Thanks for the ideas so far though, although I’m getting somewhere on my own platformer engine type thing.[/quote]What… physics in LTTP hard…?

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

An RPG is a role-playing game, which means it’s like you roll the dice and see what happens from there. Except with Pokemon, you click a move to use, and Yu-Gi-Oh being the card you use and watch away. It’s boring. An action game is one that requires actual action, like hitting the space bar to shoot, arrow keys to move freely, etc… where everything is done in real time.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool 2D Game Ideas
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Lin:

“-An RPG (These are boring and don’t have any physics what-so-ever)” No RPGs, which is what Pokemon, YGO, and Digimon are And as for a shooter game, I have obviously already thought of that. I need real ideas though, like concept, goals, design, etc…

Ohh… I know what your asking now. I’m not sure how any 2d game isn’t an RPG though.

Read full topic

Well, (Gosh, I start out just about every damn topic with that word) I’ve recently created a new 2D game engine, and before I release it, I need to create some demos showing its capability. I’m having some trouble coming up with a cool idea that isn’t too big but still very detailed. Therefore, I need your guy’s help.

What I’m Looking For:
